intro: Omalocline terglouensis, commonly known as the Terglou endemic, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Terglou in western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes numerous species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Omalocline terglouensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat.
